alert.note: Alert for Meade (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Meade County through 415 PM EDT... At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles west of Brandenburg, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Meade County, including the following locations... Concordia and Andyville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
